Some here, who readily accept that the Earth revolves around the Sun deny that the Sun, also, revolves around the Earth.  Not only are these two states of relative motion NOT mutually exclusive but are, actually, mutually inclusive and dependent.  It is impossible for body A to revolve around body B without body B to, simultaneously, revolve around body A.  I require only the Wiktionary definition of revolve to make my point.
Verb
  1. Physical movement
    3. to orbit a central point.
The choice of a central point is arbitrary in this definition.  So choosing the central point to be that point at the center of mass of the Earth gives the Sun revolving around it.  It does not matter that the Sun is 330,000 times the mass of the Earth because "revolve" indicates only the relative change in positions over time.
